intro: Cassebeeria gunneratnei, commonly known as the Sri Lankan cassebeeria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and the presence of stipules at the base of its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
